subject: Remove redundant logic to expect "undef"
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-03-13 10:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2022-03-14 14:52:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20733, 'date': '2022-03-16 11:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2022-03-16 19:55:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2022-04-04 20:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-13 10:33:53.000000000', 'message': 'Remove redundant logic to expect "undef"

In recent puppet passing "undef" to parameters result in using default
value instead, and it's not possible to pass "undef" itself.

This change removes the logic to check whether parameters are set to
undef, because these parameters default to different values and never
becomes undef.

Change-Id: I00d231035df17b8b80aaf9b3df9a186dd2fb075c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant logic to expect "undef"

In recent puppet passing "undef" to parameters result in using default
value instead, and it's not possible to pass "undef" itself.

This change removes the logic to check whether parameters are set to
undef, because these parameters default to different values and never
becomes undef.

Change-Id: I00d231035df17b8b80aaf9b3df9a186dd2fb075c

Updated return value docs of compute_service_info module

We do no longer return computed values here. Note, this breaks backward
compatibility because we do no longer return the location attribute.
It was never documenteed anyway.

commit_message:
Use python3 when present

Some newer images include python3 but not python. This change will
alias python to python3 when the executable is found.

Change-Id: I752a265c67887b6e6b2389bf4009bdbf8e2aed09

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I9e98d5731542fa33f0e0a7135a2688747a83a3ae

commit_message:
Grenade: Change to use bios because we have funky networking

Grenade, for some confusing reason, creates a separate network,
and uses that for upgrade testing as opposed to the original network
the VMs were bound to. If Julia's memory is correct, this was for
multinode upgrade testing.

Anyway, When in UEFI mode, it appears that the TFTP packets
don't get tracked nor cross the boundrary. We likley need to
explicitly address this, but first, lets get the job working as
it was and can then update it.

Also, update requirements because markupsafe removed soft_unicode
method taht was deprecated since a while. Jinja2 started using the
new soft_str method since version 3.0.0

Change-Id: Iaebe966569962b0d3d43774d57b570469479f159

commit_message:
Ensure service name is not None before lookup

We need to ensure value for 'service' provided on
identity relation before doing valid_services lookup.

Change-Id: I42fb9dbb48b3bcf8fd40700db84ec8210b8433a4
Related-Bug: #1965967

commit_message:
Add Python3 zed unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for zed.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

- Bump decorator in lower-constraints

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Ifbaf90732e367e0156b6832f8c4ab4e88d2abc31

Update .gitreview for stable/yoga

- Rename tenant with project_id

Since oslo.context=4.0.0 Feb 3, 2022  the deprecated argument
tenant was removed [1]

- Bump docutils in lower-constraints and test-requirements

subject: Remove setup.py and setup.cfg
messages: [{'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2022-04-04 15:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2022-04-04 16:34:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2022-04-04 16:35:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-04 15:37:35.000000000', 'message': "Remove setup.py and setup.cfg

Theses used to be used for building docs in the past.

A recent release of setuptools 61.0.0 introduced a breaking change [1]
which caused our openstack-tox-docs and openstack-tox-pep8 jobs to fail
with:

  error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
    ['specs', 'priorities'].

This removes setup.py and setup.cfg from use in tox.ini to resolve the
issue and they are not needed anyway.

Related-Bug: #1966382
Change-Id: Ia653b3e13302db5bf2adc006aea5436a9c65616e
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setup.py and setup.cfg

Theses used to be used for building docs in the past.

A recent release of setuptools 61.0.0 introduced a breaking change [1]
which caused our openstack-tox-docs and openstack-tox-pep8 jobs to fail
with:

  error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
    ['specs', 'priorities'].

This removes setup.py and setup.cfg from use in tox.ini to resolve the
issue and they are not needed anyway.

Related-Bug: #1966382
Change-Id: Ia653b3e13302db5bf2adc006aea5436a9c65616e

commit_message:
Remove dead method

Seems like remove_annotations() method in K8sClient is not used anymore,
it was probably only useful in data migrations code that is gone now.

Change-Id: I30dd81d289164fa3c5931222691cd627341b25c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-04 16:10:31.000000000', 'message': 'Disable setuptools auto discovery

Jobs are broken due to a release of setuptools 61.0 introducing
non-backwards compatible breaking changes [1]

Setting py_modules to an empty string here will disable autodiscovery
and should permit jobs to run as before.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Signed-off-by: Neil Hanlon <neil@shrug.pw>
Change-Id: I64c2850b6a414c68277270952676518aa7aaa85b
(cherry picked from commit 52acfb2c8196d52de0af9c9332943003b7f4c06c)
'}]
commit_message:
Disable setuptools auto discovery

Jobs are broken due to a release of setuptools 61.0 introducing
non-backwards compatible breaking changes [1]

Setting py_modules to an empty string here will disable autodiscovery
and should permit jobs to run as before.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Signed-off-by: Neil Hanlon <neil@shrug.pw>
Change-Id: I64c2850b6a414c68277270952676518aa7aaa85b
(cherry picked from commit 52acfb2c8196d52de0af9c9332943003b7f4c06c)

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-22 15:32:43.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3a150254f499503e46591e50a4c2a49b4d0ae3f0
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3a150254f499503e46591e50a4c2a49b4d0ae3f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-11 11:53:17.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I723b58578299d6f765b2a04c941f817cc2a3d49b
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I723b58578299d6f765b2a04c941f817cc2a3d49b

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-02 14:57:07.000000000', 'message': '[ceph-osd] Skip pod wait in post-apply job when disruptive

The new, disruptive post-apply logic to restart ceph-osd pods more
efficiently on upgrade still waits for pods to be in a non-
disruptive state before restarting them disruptively. This change
skips that wait if a disruptive restart is in progress.

Change-Id: I484a3b899c61066aab6be43c4077fff2db6f54bc
'}, {'created': '2022-04-02 14:58:38.000000000', 'message': '[ceph-osd] Skip pod wait in post-apply job when disruptive

The new, disruptive post-apply logic to restart ceph-osd pods more
efficiently on upgrade still waits for pods to be in a non-
disruptive state before restarting them disruptively. This change
skips that wait if a disruptive restart is in progress.

Change-Id: I484a3b899c61066aab6be43c4077fff2db6f54bc
'}]
commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Skip pod wait in post-apply job when disruptive

The new, disruptive post-apply logic to restart ceph-osd pods more
efficiently on upgrade still waits for pods to be in a non-
disruptive state before restarting them disruptively. This change
skips that wait if a disruptive restart is in progress.

Change-Id: I484a3b899c61066aab6be43c4077fff2db6f54bc

commit_message:
Change authentication section for Vagrant dev env

HAProxy role sets authentication section with syntax error
in /etc/kolla/keepalive.conf file while using dev env. Proposed change
do not deploy the section while rely on default
/etc/kolla/password.yaml settings.

Change-Id: Ibf9e6d75a9a82c3662996507758df8243d73e483
Closes-Bug: #1799078

commit_message:
Add Heat sanity check

Heat sanity check will contact the heat client
list to make sure Heat is running.

Change-Id: I97838ad5163672b2e30f42e45d201fd9696a1a0d
Partially-implements: blueprint sanity-check-container

[{'account_id': 25484, 'date': '2017-03-20 19:14:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-03-20 19:14:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-20 19:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-20 19:14:23.000000000', 'message': 'Allow alternative usernames for openstack in external-ceph

The external-ceph.yml task for nova assumes that the ceph user
will be nova & cinder. Previously the ceph.client.*.keyring was
loaded from the directory using a regex. This fix reintroduces
that behaviour.

Change-Id: I58564dd2825c60896b052559093c097c58e4b41e
Closes-Bug: #1673944
'}]
commit_message:
Allow alternative usernames for openstack in external-ceph

The external-ceph.yml task for nova assumes that the ceph user
will be nova & cinder. Previously the ceph.client.*.keyring was
loaded from the directory using a regex. This fix reintroduces
that behaviour.

Change-Id: I58564dd2825c60896b052559093c097c58e4b41e
Closes-Bug: #1673944

commit_message:
Add docs for host setup

Pull host setup operations out of the quickstart doc.

Change-Id: I0678074f9880f11968f5734fb0d9860d48d8d80e
Partially-implements: blueprint documentation-rework

commit_message:
Add the missing step in quickstart

On the steps of "Install Kolla for deployment", there should be a task
about "install the packages" after "git clone".

Change-Id: I347144821199518e3ed7fa0144e4e663f6d4aa00

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23215, 'date': '2017-06-28 14:19:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I think the regex functionality is currently good the way it is as it's flexible. In the examples you gave, you can do 'kolla-build -l swift-object$' and 'kolla-build keystone$' to match just what you need. I frequently will do 'kolla-build ^base$' to just rebuild base without all other base images for example. This patch would make that kind of filtering not possible and less useful imo."}, {'account_id': 23942, 'date': '2018-10-28 10:45:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-28 14:17:48.000000000', 'message': '(filter_images) makes filtering strict

Currently, the filtering is bogus as it's too relaxed.
It matches too much images.
Eg when using kolla-build -l to list all the intermediate base images
that are needed, it'll list unwanted images:
- asking for "swift-object" matches "swift-object-expirer" too
- "keystone" matches "keystone-fernet" & "keystone-ssh" too
  (while we only want to get "keystone-base")

This fixes the regexp to only match what was asked

Change-Id: Ia91d868d0c5fc45ce3b2038c008876d5a6bf1b7f
'}]
commit_message:
(filter_images) makes filtering strict

Currently, the filtering is bogus as it's too relaxed.
It matches too much images.
Eg when using kolla-build -l to list all the intermediate base images
that are needed, it'll list unwanted images:
- asking for "swift-object" matches "swift-object-expirer" too
- "keystone" matches "keystone-fernet" & "keystone-ssh" too
  (while we only want to get "keystone-base")

This fixes the regexp to only match what was asked

Change-Id: Ia91d868d0c5fc45ce3b2038c008876d5a6bf1b7f

commit_message:
Remove endpoint urls from trove config files

Trove shoud fetch endpoints for keystone instead of config file, so
remove endpoint url of openstack services from trove.conf and
trove-taskmanager.conf.

Change-Id: I8582c164c4023d4b17ba00001bb86c1599cc2951
Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <jeffrey.zhang@99cloud.net>

commit_message:
[WIP] dev mode: Add support for neutron

Provide support for kolla dev mode in Neutron. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'neutron_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of Neutron projects are cloned
and bindmounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: I076a2c23e919c3f2bfdba6bc2c4e4f004c8752c0

commit_message:
Drop Babel from reqs

Not needed per [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014227.html

Change-Id: I482d99159a95d67441879a3d15ebd962814987de

commit_message:
Add Nova sanity check

Nova sanity check will create a flavor and then delete
it in order to make sure Nova is running.

Change-Id: Ife730ede9b0ba7af7b51436b352024361ce6a5dc
Partially-implements: blueprint sanity-check-container

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-03 17:07:33.000000000', 'message': "[RFC] Push libvirt-guest settings to the container

According to multiple sources, the problem with vm:s not restarting
with the compute nodes is due to all things not being available yet.

This causes the machines to start, see that things are missing and
shut down again. According to the same sources, ON_SHUTDOWN should
be set to shutdown instead of suspend - but I really don't know if
that is the case.

Since there is no way to currently push this via ansible, this
patch should implement that basic functionality.

NOTE: the sysconfig dir is only used on ubuntu and RHEL/centos but
 it seems like thats all kolla-ansible cares about at the moment.

Change-Id: Id93a2de43fbab94456f5ce3318d8008fa71291cf
"}, {'created': '2017-02-03 22:10:55.000000000', 'message': "[RFC] Push libvirt-guest settings to the container

"}]
commit_message:
[RFC] Push libvirt-guest settings to the container

According to multiple sources, the problem with vm:s not restarting
with the compute nodes is due to all things not being available yet.

This causes the machines to start, see that things are missing and
shut down again. According to the same sources, ON_SHUTDOWN should
be set to shutdown instead of suspend - but I really don't know if
that is the case.

Since there is no way to currently push this via ansible, this
patch should implement that basic functionality.

NOTE: the sysconfig dir is only used on ubuntu and RHEL/centos but
 it seems like thats all kolla-ansible cares about at the moment.

Change-Id: Id93a2de43fbab94456f5ce3318d8008fa71291cf

commit_message:
Add image for networking-vpp ML2 driver and agent

This patch add new neutron server image which includes networking-vpp ML2 driver,
as well as a new container image for VPP Neutron agent.

Change-Id: Ifb83bb4c180bd810180f54647dd6176f40464cc7
Signed-off-by: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add proxy support

The script that installs Docker services in Debian OSes doesn't have
instructions for instances localed inside of a corporate network. This
change include those instructions taking those values from global
environment variables.

Change-Id: Ib84a1c926daef9b7e9ef3529abedcb44bb1fcd50

This enables to kick graceful shutdown when stop/restart
actions are executed.

Partially-implements: blueprint graceful-shutdown

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-10 19:17:41.000000000', 'message': "Add RPM GPG keys import retry

It's has become more and more often that some zuul job fails on downloading
RPM GPG key from external source.
This change slightly modify the way how the GPG keys are imported.
It's a trade of between ability of 'rpm --import' to use file or url
and curl which allows to retry download.

Change-Id: I6b205db2f3c01c6802e637723167ffc6d3c66d17
Closes-Bug: 1828542
"}]
commit_message:
Add RPM GPG keys import retry

It's has become more and more often that some zuul job fails on downloading
RPM GPG key from external source.
This change slightly modify the way how the GPG keys are imported.
It's a trade of between ability of 'rpm --import' to use file or url
and curl which allows to retry download.

Change-Id: I6b205db2f3c01c6802e637723167ffc6d3c66d17
Closes-Bug: 1828542

messages: [{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2022-04-01 09:38:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2022-04-04 08:58:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2022-04-04 14:49:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-01 09:38:07.000000000', 'message': "Resolve issue with mod_proxy decoding

The Ceph RADOS Gateway uses some unusual URI's for multisite
replication; ensure that mod_proxy passes the 'raw' URI down
to the radosgw http endpoint so that client and server side
signatures continue to match.

This seems quite Ceph specific so the template is specialised
into the charm rather than updated in charm-helpers.

Change-Id: Iede49ba8904500076d53388345e154a3ed18e761
Closes-Bug: 1966669
(cherry picked from commit 7907fa96e93085e114fb42f2dc547963938498fb)
"}]
commit_message:
Resolve issue with mod_proxy decoding

The Ceph RADOS Gateway uses some unusual URI's for multisite
replication; ensure that mod_proxy passes the 'raw' URI down
to the radosgw http endpoint so that client and server side
signatures continue to match.

This seems quite Ceph specific so the template is specialised
into the charm rather than updated in charm-helpers.

Change-Id: Iede49ba8904500076d53388345e154a3ed18e761
Closes-Bug: 1966669
(cherry picked from commit 7907fa96e93085e114fb42f2dc547963938498fb)

commit_message:
Fix a error when l3-agent gets filter id for ip

Before using filter_id in _get_filterid_for_ip(), we should assign it first.

Closes-Bug: #1955775

Change-Id: Icea0a8b756f210761b635d2d34e2af04a939a640
(cherry picked from commit 0255eb31e5c3ce31ed08069c4e5c0fcb1fc29074)

commit_message:
Move the projects list following the stable branch policy

TC is removing the tag framework. Stable policy tag has the
list of projects following the stable branch policy
- https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/stable_follows-policy.html#application-to-current-deliverables

Moving that list to stable branch policy doc which will be
helpful to know the projects following the polic.

Change-Id: Ic28b9534f0432bf1ba1f24bbe0582e6aa68223de

commit_message:
Modify the project specific stable team management

In Xena, TC passed the resolution about enabling the
project team manage their stable core team.
- https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20210923-stable-core-team.html

This commits relfects that resolution in stable branch
policy document.

Change-Id: I43d41cd9a1e0af0b0f2e4fc145f97c3ff4f76f8e

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-23 11:38:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add "qos_policy_id" field to "Router" OVO

This new synthetic field is linked to a
"QosRouterGatewayIPPolicyBinding" register. This binding register will
bind a QoS policy and a Router.  Now is possible to provide this field
in the create/update input parameters. If provided, the "Router" OVO will
create/delete the "QosRouterGatewayIPPolicyBinding" register.

The "Router" OVO takes this parameter from the DB object. When the DB
object is retrieved, the QoS policy binding register is retrieved too
due to a backref link in the "QosRouterGatewayIPPolicyBinding" DB model to
the "Router" DB model.

Related-Bug: #1893625
Related-Bug: #1950454

Change-Id: I59ed68b2c1e19f1f31e72b4868e3db750ef06d6f

commit_message:
Add "qos_policy_id" field to "Router" OVO

This new synthetic field is linked to a
"QosRouterGatewayIPPolicyBinding" register. This binding register will
bind a QoS policy and a Router.  Now is possible to provide this field
in the create/update input parameters. If provided, the "Router" OVO will
create/delete the "QosRouterGatewayIPPolicyBinding" register.

The "Router" OVO takes this parameter from the DB object. When the DB
object is retrieved, the QoS policy binding register is retrieved too
due to a backref link in the "QosRouterGatewayIPPolicyBinding" DB model to
the "Router" DB model.

Related-Bug: #1893625
Related-Bug: #1950454

Change-Id: I59ed68b2c1e19f1f31e72b4868e3db750ef06d6f

[{'created': '2022-04-03 03:05:46.000000000', 'message': 'Disable vTPM capabilities by default

Disable the vTPM capabilities by default. The necessary dependencies
have not been backported to focal (as of yet), requiring the packages to
be provided in a PPA. Rather than install this PPA by default, the charm
will disable the vTPM features by default and require the user to enable
them.

Change-Id: Id0521b4dd6a3e5a768cab14855e4f3fec240ff77
'}]
commit_message:
Disable vTPM capabilities by default

Disable the vTPM capabilities by default. The necessary dependencies
have not been backported to focal (as of yet), requiring the packages to
be provided in a PPA. Rather than install this PPA by default, the charm
will disable the vTPM features by default and require the user to enable
them.

Change-Id: Id0521b4dd6a3e5a768cab14855e4f3fec240ff77

commit_message:
Add configuration option for heartbeat_in_pthread

This configuration option has been observed to result in file
descriptor leaks in certain circumstances. A variable is added
here so that it can be easily overridden.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/835548

commit_message:
Allow access to secure uuidd socket

Nova uses python libraries, which uses libuuid in order to generate
UUIDs. The apparmor profile does not allow for the nova-compute service
to access the /run/uuidd/request socket in order to generate a secure
UUID. Update the apparmor profile to allow nova to use the uuid service.

Closes-Bug: #1958689
Change-Id: I2ec6e7aba5c84c697733227ce36f762e4787cce1

commit_message:
Allow read access to firmware information

Update the apparmor profile for nova-compute to allow it to read the
firmware configuration information for qemu. This is necessary in order
to launch instances using UEFI when apparmor enforcement is enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1958686
Change-Id: I7d9152dcc684923600c40ff0227c3c3eaafa7574

commit_message:
CI: Avoid image downloads and builds in seed jobs

This change is a combination of previous changes, with some adaptations
for changes in Victoria:

* Ib59c8bc2d8938eca18c943bb2e66ed185152a739
* If657bf5b0117812d3c53942464cc41cf86cc8ad5

The overall effect is to disable IPA and overcloud host image builds in
seed jobs, since these can be unreliable.

Change-Id: I3c59fa140a89d7d761846cc712e65aa0efda1363

commit_message:
Add extra-repositories config option

Add an extra-repositories config option to nova-compute in order to
allow configuring additional apt repositories. This is useful when some
packages are not available in the distro or cloud archive.

Change-Id: Ie3b76ff3bc07b83e416c80fab1da2560d48df498

There are some inline comments, and the patch is missing a release note.'}, {'account_id': 29074, 'date': '2021-06-25 10:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29074, 'date': '2021-06-25 10:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thank you for the feedback.
I have added the release note and updated the texts.

We can actually be sure that the volume service will never process the attachment request. When setting the volume to detached the volume_attachment is marked as deleted. The volume manager is calling `objects.VolumeAttachment.get_by_id` at its start which whill raise a `VolumeAttachmentNotFound` as the attachment has been deleted.

I have improved this part to get the volume attachment as the first step inside `attachment_update` so that we fail earily there.

I have also added some logging output to make it easier to understand where this exception comes from.

I am not sure if the wording of the message is reasonable and if reraising the exception is the right way to abort here.'}, {'account_id': 28801, 'date': '2021-06-25 11:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Abandoning this as i currently have no time to work on it. If anyone is interested feel free to pick it up'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-26 10:24:21.000000000', 'message': 'Revert attachment creation on failure

when creating a volume attachment with a already specified connector and
the call to cinder-volume fails we leave a volume attachment in the
state "reserved" behind and have the volume also in the state
"reserved".

If same call succeeds afterwards the volume has two attachments. One in
"in-use" and one in "reserved". If the volume is later detached the one in
"reserved" will still exist and cause the volume to be stuck in this
state.

This can especially happen during live-migrations as nova already passes
the connector information during the _pre_live_migration phase.

To work around this issue we remove the volume attachment completely
if the call to cinder-volume fails.
This will not have any implications for callers that do not pass the
connector information. If the caller passes the connector information
then the method will now either succeed or cleanly roll back but
will no longer leave resources behind.

Closes-Bug: #1929678
Change-Id: Ia3441837fa83c7c3517c77fcef9482bf5f1d6d71
'}, {'created': '2021-06-25 10:00:58.000000000', 'message': 'Revert attachment creation on failure

When creating a volume attachment with an already specified connector
and the call to cinder-volume fails we leave a volume attachment in the
state "reserved" behind and have the volume also in the state
"reserved".

If same call succeeds afterwards the volume has two attachments. One in
"in-use" and one in "reserved". If the volume is later detached the one
in "reserved" will still exist and cause the volume to be stuck in this
state.

This can especially happen during live-migrations as nova already passes
the connector information during the _pre_live_migration phase.

To work around this issue we remove the volume attachment completely
if the call to cinder-volume fails.
This will not have any implications for callers that do not pass the
connector information. If the caller passes the connector information
then the method will now either succeed or cleanly roll back but
will no longer leave resources behind.

Closes-Bug: #1929678
Change-Id: Ia3441837fa83c7c3517c77fcef9482bf5f1d6d71
'}]
commit_message:
Revert attachment creation on failure

When creating a volume attachment with an already specified connector
and the call to cinder-volume fails we leave a volume attachment in the
state "reserved" behind and have the volume also in the state
"reserved".

If same call succeeds afterwards the volume has two attachments. One in
"in-use" and one in "reserved". If the volume is later detached the one
in "reserved" will still exist and cause the volume to be stuck in this
state.

This can especially happen during live-migrations as nova already passes
the connector information during the _pre_live_migration phase.

To work around this issue we remove the volume attachment completely
if the call to cinder-volume fails.
This will not have any implications for callers that do not pass the
connector information. If the caller passes the connector information
then the method will now either succeed or cleanly roll back but
will no longer leave resources behind.

Closes-Bug: #1929678
Change-Id: Ia3441837fa83c7c3517c77fcef9482bf5f1d6d71

commit_message:
Fix smtp server authentication

- Set Tox checks as voting false

This configuration option has been observed to result in file
descriptor leaks in certain circumstances. A variable is added

Change-Id: I833d72715daff81b64da077e899615b9b2002650
Related-Bug: #1961603
(cherry picked from commit 01951cd77b7edfc1008da14c1afd4e260fcf432f)

commit_message:
Add configuration option for heartbeat_in_pthread

This configuration option has been observed to result in file
descriptor leaks in certain circumstances. A variable is added
here so that it can be easily overridden.

Change-Id: I833d72715daff81b64da077e899615b9b2002650
Related-Bug: #1961603
(cherry picked from commit 01951cd77b7edfc1008da14c1afd4e260fcf432f)

messages: [{'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2022-03-30 16:28:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2022-03-30 16:29:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2022-03-31 07:53:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2022-04-01 10:30:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2022-04-02 13:47:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Review-Priority+1\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2022-04-04 09:41:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-30 16:28:25.000000000', 'message': 'macros/pip: revert to old setuptools way

AArch64 builds fail with "AttributeError: install_layout". This is due
to setuptools issue in Debian:

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=1003252

Switching setuptools to use distutils from stdlib makes error go away.

Backports: Xena, Wallaby (this is where it was first reported).
Change-Id: I97102e18e4ec47bca94d17d964936f039580b06b
(cherry picked from commit 497b40fe5a4984b959c63f0c5320311f5810192e)

Backports: Xena, Wallaby (this is where it was first reported).

(cherry picked from commit 497b40fe5a4984b959c63f0c5320311f5810192e)
'}, {'created': '2022-04-01 10:30:25.000000000', 'message': 'macros/pip: revert to old setuptools way

'}]
commit_message:
macros/pip: revert to old setuptools way

AArch64 builds fail with "AttributeError: install_layout". This is due
to setuptools issue in Debian:

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=1003252

Switching setuptools to use distutils from stdlib makes error go away.

Backports: Xena, Wallaby (this is where it was first reported).
Change-Id: I97102e18e4ec47bca94d17d964936f039580b06b
(cherry picked from commit 497b40fe5a4984b959c63f0c5320311f5810192e)

commit_message:
Make inventory file writable

Looks like ansible_runner.utils.dump_artifact() makes it
read-only and redeploy fails with permission error.

Closes-Bug: #1950767
Change-Id: I32acdb51ac12be08c94efa5c198ea83549a8f034
(cherry picked from commit 6b2892508aa519a7febcf6410feb93dc83a51b42)

This configuration option has been observed to result in file
descriptor leaks in certain circumstances. A variable is added
here so that it can be easily overridden.

(cherry picked from commit b1e38084ccb6dce4967fa8aeaf33a47ffd03689b)

commit_message:
Remove create_loginable_secgroup_rule()

In tempest 27.0.0 release, Scenario manager in tempest
have been marked stable[1]. In Xena PTG, it has been
decided to start the consumption of stable-scenario-
manager within the tempest plugins[2].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/unreleased.html#relnotes-27-0-0
[2] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/qa-xena-priority#L48

Remove create_volume() and create_volume_type()

In tempest 27.0.0 release, Scenario manager in tempest
have been marked stable[1]. In Xena PTG, it has been
decided to start the consumption of stable-scenario-
manager within the tempest plugins[2].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/unreleased.html#relnotes-27-0-0
[2] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/qa-xena-priority#L48

Signed-off-by: Soniya Vyas <svyas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I6efb473758e972df0f3a0af511c3eb3e8eac15be
Depends-On: Ie8dbd0adafb9450d84ebd1e50d17c7f14a5db6bf

commit_message:
Remove setup_clients() api

In tempest 27.0.0 release, Scenario manager in tempest
have been marked stable[1]. In Xena PTG, it has been
decided to start the consumption of stable-scenario-
manager within the tempest plugins[2].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/unreleased.html#relnotes-27-0-0
[2] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/qa-xena-priority#L48

Following are the methods cleaned within this review:

1. setup_clients()

Signed-off-by: Soniya Vyas <svyas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie8dbd0adafb9450d84ebd1e50d17c7f14a5db6bf

commit_message:
Update python testing classifier

Yoga testing runtime[1] has been updated to add py39
testing as voting. Unit tests update are handled by the
job template change in openstack-zuul-job

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/820286

this commit updates the classifier in setup.cfg file.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/yoga.html

Change-Id: Idb98e3b64528bb5ad12e7292bfb18c159585f87b

commit_message:
Add configuration option for heartbeat_in_pthread

This configuration option has been observed to result in file
descriptor leaks in certain circumstances. A variable is added
here so that it can be easily overridden.

Related-Bug: #1961603
Change-Id: I8155264b181d6f21728804ef8260979931597427
(cherry picked from commit 6efa45e2bdc3d478eead0b8d7b179c2ed49f9841)

commit_message:
Reference to vars_files is missing from playbook

A check resources was introduced as part of the composable_roles
modifications, but one of the playbooks is referring to variables
without referencing them on the vars_files parameter, leading to
undefined variables

Change-Id: If4bbf91bc4716ea1aeb3cf2320173f128e374c8b

subject: WIP - Trunk support
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-04 09:18:51.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - Trunk support

Add support for neutron trunk ports.

This implementation will only bind/plug subports where
the segmentation_type is VLAN, also the segmentation_id
on subports must match the segmentation_id of the subports
neutron network. (I.e no vlan-rewrite support)

Device ports are configured with the parent port as the native
VLAN, and subport VLAN as tagged vlans.

Change-Id: I23bd3945fe3ee012a3080c6959167d4908f95fcd
'}]
commit_message:
WIP - Trunk support

Add support for neutron trunk ports.

This implementation will only bind/plug subports where
the segmentation_type is VLAN, also the segmentation_id
on subports must match the segmentation_id of the subports
neutron network. (I.e no vlan-rewrite support)

Device ports are configured with the parent port as the native
VLAN, and subport VLAN as tagged vlans.

Change-Id: I23bd3945fe3ee012a3080c6959167d4908f95fcd

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3806fca3198865ce72fb051f0fbe0d19af730068

commit_message:
Change to a proper policy for Resume operation

Previously, ToggleSuspend class checked 'os-rescue' policy for resuming
an instance. To align to resume operation, this fix changes to
'os-suspend-server:resume'.

Closes-Bug: #1963652
Change-Id: If6386ecdb81fb1f0d88dab447ee81c251b9857b7
(cherry picked from commit 29da801528a357449264e546182bd629f4654275)
(cherry picked from commit db40c8ceb6c403bc94ac839f65c00805a5e4ff66)
(cherry picked from commit d3bb9cd86a72fb270ff4f4d2b5ddea04c899ef53)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-08 06:35:36.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Updating sriov_config.service to run before driverctl.slice and network-pre"

This reverts commit 561a7df54a558c5977cd1e60511e63e443e1bf4e.

Reason for revert: The change in dependencies is creating a regression for regular DPDK (non nic partitioning) + SR-IOV use cases.
The DPDK interfaces are not bound with vfio-pci driver during  reboots, resulting in complete disruption in networks attached to the port.

Change-Id: I18664d588c951527be9f7423a7ebfeb2c82a3398
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Updating sriov_config.service to run before driverctl.slice and network-pre"

This reverts commit 561a7df54a558c5977cd1e60511e63e443e1bf4e.

Reason for revert: The change in dependencies is creating a regression for regular DPDK (non nic partitioning) + SR-IOV use cases.
The DPDK interfaces are not bound with vfio-pci driver during  reboots, resulting in complete disruption in networks attached to the port.

Change-Id: I18664d588c951527be9f7423a7ebfeb2c82a3398

commit_message:
Revert "Updating sriov_config.service to run before driverctl.slice and network-pre"

This reverts commit 9780dfa11b05848b35e65160997a80f554a0aacf.

Reason for revert: The change in dependencies is creating a regression for regular DPDK (non nic partitioning) + SR-IOV use cases.
The DPDK interfaces are not bound with vfio-pci driver during  reboots, resulting in complete disruption in networks attached to the port.

Change-Id: Ia568e0cf8e9ca3eda3c965646b05694fe003fa63

commit_message:
Migration ceph stable charms to charmhub - pacific

This is the stable/pacific branch of the ceph charms.  It tests against
focal-ussuri (validates octopus) and focal-wallaby (validates pacific).

Change-Id: Ie7df5a0be5cfaffa764c76435bc1583561ef54d4

commit_message:
Add configuration option for heartbeat_in_pthread

This configuration option has been observed to result in file
descriptor leaks in certain circumstances. A variable is added
here so that it can be easily overridden.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/835548
Related-Bug: #1961603
Change-Id: I8155264b181d6f21728804ef8260979931597427
(cherry picked from commit 6efa45e2bdc3d478eead0b8d7b179c2ed49f9841)

'}, {'created': '2022-03-09 05:06:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add Datacore Software volume driver

Datacore SANsymphony volume driver Supports both iSCSI and Fibre Channel
with DataCore server group running SANsymphony software version 10 PSP6
or later.

Implements: datacore-volume-cinder-driver
Change-Id: I520c743c3a421d66bc142ce06a43aa04e13beb8c
'}, {'created': '2022-04-04 05:48:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bugs spotted by tox

Providing a fix for AttributeError while creating volume
from snapshot/clone.

Add variable datacore_fc_unallowed_targets, this will
prevent the DataCore FibreChannel volume driver from
using some front-end targets in volume attachment

Add validation for valid FibreChannel initiator

Change-Id: I520c743c3a421d66bc142ce06a43aa04e13beb8c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bugs spotted by tox

Providing a fix for AttributeError while creating volume
from snapshot/clone.

Add variable datacore_fc_unallowed_targets, this will
prevent the DataCore FibreChannel volume driver from
using some front-end targets in volume attachment

Add validation for valid FibreChannel initiator

Change-Id: I520c743c3a421d66bc142ce06a43aa04e13beb8c

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2ef8b737df187130990bb5a83582c650df823ac8

subject: Resolve issue with mod_proxy decoding
messages: [{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2022-03-31 08:26:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2022-04-01 09:52:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2022-04-04 08:58:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-31 08:26:55.000000000', 'message': "Resolve issue with mod_proxy decoding

The Ceph RADOS Gateway uses some unusual URI's for multisite
replication; ensure that mod_proxy passes the 'raw' URI down
to the radosgw http endpoint so that client and server side
signatures continue to match.

This seems quite Ceph specific so the template is specialised
into the charm rather than updated in charm-helpers.

Change-Id: Iede49ba8904500076d53388345e154a3ed18e761
Closes-Bug: 1966669
(cherry picked from commit 7907fa96e93085e114fb42f2dc547963938498fb)
"}]
commit_message:
Resolve issue with mod_proxy decoding

The Ceph RADOS Gateway uses some unusual URI's for multisite
replication; ensure that mod_proxy passes the 'raw' URI down
to the radosgw http endpoint so that client and server side
signatures continue to match.

This seems quite Ceph specific so the template is specialised
into the charm rather than updated in charm-helpers.

Change-Id: Iede49ba8904500076d53388345e154a3ed18e761
Closes-Bug: 1966669
(cherry picked from commit 7907fa96e93085e114fb42f2dc547963938498fb)

commit_message:
Fixed Ansible branch in base job openstack-tox-linters-ansible

Ansible's git repository has no master branch but a devel and several
stable-* branches instead.

Change-Id: I43844c8a1cefceb7337e5a6ff1e8b8df451efb26

commit_message:
Centos8 wallaby jobs teardown - standalone/scenario jobs

This removes the standalone/scenarios from running on stable
wallaby.

This includes a tidy up of the layout to avoid a lot of
repetition using yaml anchors/overrides. This is related to
the change as we had to use branches: overrides on the centos9
jobs in the layout (as well as the existing c8 ones) which
became very messy/long.

Also include reparenting for the scenario standalones as
they were inheriting from the 8 equivalent directly with
inverse branches: matches. See [1] for more context and [2]
for topic branch/test patches.

Removes obsolete c8 jobs like
tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario010-standalone-wallaby
tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario010-ovn-provider-standalone-wallaby
tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario010-ovn-provider-standalone

Moves tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario010-standalone deprecated for now

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-February/027403.html
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:c8_wallaby_teardown

Change-Id: I67bec4b9d25cf1a3d1c55f254e9c321ed979b172

commit_message:
Migration ceph stable charms to charmhub - octopus

This is the stable/octopus branch of the ceph charms.  It tests against
{focal,bionic}-ussuri (validates octopus) and bionic-train
(validates nautilus).

Change-Id: Ic9fa430b5b62bf045c4d7c89371f359b429c1ba2
(cherry picked from commit c105015a6692f6571d54dcab09f6811997ac725b)

commit_message:
Add configuration option for heartbeat_in_pthread

This configuration option has been observed to result in file
descriptor leaks in certain circumstances. A variable is added
here so that it can be easily overridden.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/835548
Change-Id: I7de034307da9352e6f5d1f5f175a330fb8c86463
Related-Bug: #1961603
(cherry picked from commit b1e38084ccb6dce4967fa8aeaf33a47ffd03689b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-31 10:35:16.000000000', 'message': "Refactored tox requirements for different Ansible releases

Sorted pip requirements file to improve readability.

Moved pip requirements for tests into tests subdirectory and dropped
'pip-' prefix to shorten filenames and conform with common naming
scheme for pip requirements files.

Added constrains on OpenStack SDK 1.*.* to job ansible-collections-\
openstack-functional-devstack-releases on master branch because only
stable/1.0.0 branch is compatible to the OpenStack SDK 0.*.* series.

Changed job ansible-collections-openstack-functional-devstack-releases
on master branch to non-voting because OpenStack SDK 1.*.* has not
been released to PyPI yet, so tests on master branch are expected to
fail once we introduce breaking changes from stable/1.0.0 branch.

Change-Id: I6b6bb8c6900f7c8341bbf3f9a24999fbf693ba4b
"}]
commit_message:
Refactored tox requirements for different Ansible releases

Sorted pip requirements file to improve readability.

Moved pip requirements for tests into tests subdirectory and dropped
'pip-' prefix to shorten filenames and conform with common naming
scheme for pip requirements files.

Added constrains on OpenStack SDK 1.*.* to job ansible-collections-\
openstack-functional-devstack-releases on master branch because only
stable/1.0.0 branch is compatible to the OpenStack SDK 0.*.* series.

Changed job ansible-collections-openstack-functional-devstack-releases
on master branch to non-voting because OpenStack SDK 1.*.* has not
been released to PyPI yet, so tests on master branch are expected to
fail once we introduce breaking changes from stable/1.0.0 branch.

Change-Id: I6b6bb8c6900f7c8341bbf3f9a24999fbf693ba4b

[{'created': '2022-04-03 15:19:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wrong attribute to find remote address

The webob.Request class does not have the remote_address attribute but
the remote_addr attribute. This change fixes the wrong attribute
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1967683
Change-Id: I5bab310fef66faa3291e7651106010761f636bc5
'}, {'created': '2022-04-03 15:24:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wrong attribute to find remote address

the remote_addr attribute. This change fixes usage of the non-existing
attribute accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1967683
Change-Id: I5bab310fef66faa3291e7651106010761f636bc5

commit_message:
Remove ineffective codes from the FaultWrapper middleware

These three variables are initialized but unused.

Closes-Bug: #1967683
Change-Id: I5bab310fef66faa3291e7651106010761f636bc5

commit_message:
Fix KeyError in get_attribute function

Fix KeyError is raised in get_attribute validation in case of
nested data types.
The data type schema was not correctly managed.

Closes-Bug: 1965089
Change-Id: Ic87a3c429105d6108507de05a31b788538ee2259

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-10 06:10:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bugs spotted by tox

Providing a fix for AttributeError while creating volume
from snapshot/clone.

Add variable datacore_fc_unallowed_targets, this will
prevent the DataCore FibreChannel volume driver from
using some front-end targets in volume attachment

Add validation for valid FibreChannel initiator

Change-Id: I601725e0a72b8c5f8b44ac6572eed6710d0564c2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bugs spotted by tox

Providing a fix for AttributeError while creating volume
from snapshot/clone.

Add variable datacore_fc_unallowed_targets, this will
prevent the DataCore FibreChannel volume driver from
using some front-end targets in volume attachment

Add validation for valid FibreChannel initiator

Change-Id: I601725e0a72b8c5f8b44ac6572eed6710d0564c2

subject: Match configure-mirrors for CentOS wheel URLs
messages: [{'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2022-04-01 16:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2022-04-01 16:15:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2022-04-04 04:17:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-01 16:14:40.000000000', 'message': 'Match configure-mirrors for CentOS wheel URLs

The configure-mirrors role in zuul-jobs expects CentOS wheels will
be in URLs like distro-ver-arch and so doesn't include "-stream"
like our wheel publishing jobs are adding. This was a necessary
distinction in order to differentiate between CentOS Linux 8 and
CentOS Stream 8 wheels, but since configure-mirrors didn't know to
tell Stream nodes to look in the other location, this was actually
broken from the moment it was introduced and we simply never noticed
until we removed the old centos-8 volume (at which point
centos-8-stream nodes no longer found any wheels).

As we no longer have centos-8 nodes, rather than try to change how
configure-mirrors works (since it may be successfully used in other
sites already and would need advance warning or complex overrides in
base jobs), simply rearrange our mirrors to mount the volumes in the
paths it expects. Once this merges I'll adjust AFS accordingly.

This partially reverts 3d776f6734ff0c5197471c7a89aa84511a0eff88.

Change-Id: I07ee7ccdd10e68f6f38ec362ce7e5d333d5fc2f7
'}]
commit_message:
Match configure-mirrors for CentOS wheel URLs

The configure-mirrors role in zuul-jobs expects CentOS wheels will
be in URLs like distro-ver-arch and so doesn't include "-stream"
like our wheel publishing jobs are adding. This was a necessary
distinction in order to differentiate between CentOS Linux 8 and
CentOS Stream 8 wheels, but since configure-mirrors didn't know to
tell Stream nodes to look in the other location, this was actually
broken from the moment it was introduced and we simply never noticed
until we removed the old centos-8 volume (at which point
centos-8-stream nodes no longer found any wheels).

As we no longer have centos-8 nodes, rather than try to change how
configure-mirrors works (since it may be successfully used in other
sites already and would need advance warning or complex overrides in
base jobs), simply rearrange our mirrors to mount the volumes in the
paths it expects. Once this merges I'll adjust AFS accordingly.

This partially reverts 3d776f6734ff0c5197471c7a89aa84511a0eff88.

Change-Id: I07ee7ccdd10e68f6f38ec362ce7e5d333d5fc2f7

subject: Update to build using charmcraft
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-01-27 15:46:57.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate charm to charmhub latest/edge track

Change-Id: Iadd11634d1fe44731ecf0a6104561b4aeebff23f
'}, {'created': '2022-01-27 22:00:42.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate charm to charmhub latest/edge track

Change-Id: Iadd11634d1fe44731ecf0a6104561b4aeebff23f
'}, {'created': '2022-02-01 20:53:57.000000000', 'message': 'Update to build using charmcraft

Due to a build problem with the reactive plugin, this change falls back
on overriding the steps and doing a manual build, but it also ensures
the CI system builds the charm using charmcraft.  Changes:

- add a build-requirements.txt
- modify charmcraft.yaml
- modify osci.yaml
    -> indicate build with charmcraft
- modify tox.ini
    -> tox -e build does charmcraft build/rename
    -> tox -e build-reactive does the reactive build
- modify bundles to use the <charm>.charm artifact in tests.
  and fix deprecation warning re: prefix
- tox inception to enable tox -e func-test in the CI

Change-Id: Iadd11634d1fe44731ecf0a6104561b4aeebff23f

commit_message:
Update to build using charmcraft

Due to a build problem with the reactive plugin, this change falls back
on overriding the steps and doing a manual build, but it also ensures
the CI system builds the charm using charmcraft.  Changes:

- add a build-requirements.txt
- modify charmcraft.yaml
- modify osci.yaml
    -> indicate build with charmcraft
- modify tox.ini
    -> tox -e build does charmcraft build/rename
    -> tox -e build-reactive does the reactive build
- modify bundles to use the <charm>.charm artifact in tests.
  and fix deprecation warning re: prefix
- tox inception to enable tox -e func-test in the CI
- Unit test fix

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-keystone/+/830986
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-interface-keystone/+/830988
Change-Id: Iadd11634d1fe44731ecf0a6104561b4aeebff23f
Co-authored-by: Aurelien Lourot <aurelien.lourot@canonical.com>

Change-Id: Ib1d9dcd5c9728e8cb3a599b2916d4e6e88b70b57

commit_message:
Update default libvirt image to focal

This change updates the libvirt image to use ubuntu focal by
default. This is due to newer releases of nova no longer
supporting versions of libvirt older than 7.0.0.

Change-Id: Ib1d9dcd5c9728e8cb3a599b2916d4e6e88b70b57

subject: Fix extra facts gathering with tags
messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2022-03-25 18:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2022-03-28 14:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2022-04-03 13:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-25 18:56:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix extra facts gathering with tags

When switching to gathering min facts, we introduced common task that
was responsible for gathering specific subset. However we used
include_task and not applied always tag to include. That resulted in
effect that facts were not gathered when playbook run with tags
and leads to failure.

To workaround that we move include to prior facts gathering stanza.

As alternative option for ceph we applied always tag to include.

Change-Id: Ie996262043edb8fb9c7221a5cd98e98a0111ac28
'}]
commit_message:
Fix extra facts gathering with tags

When switching to gathering min facts, we introduced common task that
was responsible for gathering specific subset. However we used
include_task and not applied always tag to include. That resulted in
effect that facts were not gathered when playbook run with tags
and leads to failure.

To workaround that we move include to prior facts gathering stanza.

As alternative option for ceph we applied always tag to include.

Change-Id: Ie996262043edb8fb9c7221a5cd98e98a0111ac28

Spec looks to abstract to me. It doesn't says how exactly things need to be implemented, how it will work, exact APIs etc. One can get the idea but he will not be able to implement it from this spec. Also look my comments inline"}, {'account_id': 14265, 'date': '2015-07-13 10:52:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

regarding to Stan's recent comments it seems that it will not be so easy to store stats to DB and once a minute fire aggregated message to ceilometer. I am still not fully convinced that we need this optimization. We can inspire from other projects with ceilometer integration. Opinions of others about this performance optimization are welcomed. My view on it is that it could make implemenation more difficult and complex on the other hand it is quite unsure whether it will improve something."}, {'account_id': 14265, 'date': '2015-07-13 11:06:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7478, 'date': '2015-07-13 11:08:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Folks, Ceilometer team now is working on declarative notification stuff: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/declarative-notifications . The idea is to have a .yaml file which describes how to parse notifications. After this bp is implemented you may just add your murano-rules into .yaml file and not create any code in Ceilometer. 
Also, Ceilometer community is considering the variant to delegate the ownership of this file to projects which wants to be measured by Ceilometer. It means that Murano will keep it's own .yaml file in project tree. But this idea is still under discussion.
So the question is: is it ok for you to wait for Ceilometer's stuff or not?"}, {'account_id': 7549, 'date': '2015-07-13 15:51:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7549, 'date': '2015-07-14 11:52:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7226, 'date': '2015-07-14 12:11:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

My main concern is not yet addressed. I recommend to set workflow to -1 (WiP) until then'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-07-14 12:20:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified+1

[{'created': '2020-05-05 22:16:48.000000000', 'message': 'Add stable branch jobs on the plugins master gate

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(stein, train, ussuri) use the Tempest and plugins master
version for their testing. To make sure master version (new
tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,
we need to add the stable branches job on the plugins master gate.
Tempest and many other plugins are already testing the stable
branches in same way[1].

Ussuri onwards, Tempest or plugins are py3 only, so we are
running only python3 version of stable jobs

Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

commit_message:
Add stable branch jobs on the plugins master gate

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(ussuri, victoria, wallaby, and xena) use the Tempest and plugins
master version for their testing. To make sure master version (new
tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,
we need to add the stable branches job on the plugins master gate.
Tempest and many other plugins are already testing the stable
branches in same way[1].

Ussuri onwards, Tempest or plugins are py3 only, so we are
running only python3 version of stable jobs

Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

 [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/e8f1876aa6772077f85f380677b30251c2454505/.zuul.yaml#L646

Change-Id: Ib7b44634eae3b3ee4040380f589b1964a783f99b

commit_message:
Add new test cases for TLD test suite

New test: "test_zone_creation_fails_for_not_existing_tld"
When not existing TLD is used to create a zone,
"400 Bad Request (Invalid TLD) is expected to be raised.

Change-Id: I6abb6622cc49d0b6eb68f52e7a78271efa3491ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-06 14:51:52.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Use checks for config and optimize

The proposed approach allows for checking whether config
files are current, e.g. cases when the deployment was aborted after
config files were generated but before they were injected into the
containers which lead to old config staying in containers.

After this patch we can do:
  kolla-ansible genconfig
  kolla-ansible deploy-containers
and it would generally do what we expected rather than being a noop
in the second part.

We also get nice refactoring and lose the need to have notifies
and whens in config and handler sections respectively.
This might fix some hidden bugs where the check tasks forgot to
include params important for the service.

We also get a nice optimization by using filtered loop instead of
task skipping per service with 'when'.

Note this patch builds upon genconfig optimization and it takes it
further by not having genconfig ever touch the handlers!

Oh, and this gets us closer to the single responsibility principle -
config only generates the config, container checks only validate
whether container restart is needed.

Future work:
- optimize for large files
  - could we get away with comparing timestamps and sizes?
    container's should have a newer timestamp due to copy,
    could also preserve it
- optimize config by doing local generation and mass rsync
- support for reloads
- unconditional restart/reload (separate action)
- make 'reconfigure' act like 'genconfig' + 'deploy-containers'
  - this would avoid calling bootstrapping each time but might
    be tricky as it would break current compatibility
  - could call this 'reconfigure-containers' and deprecate
    'reconfigure'

WIP: PoC for Neutron to let you validate the approach.

Change-Id: I0ce24043ae5486b2b55489ba40abe2b96b0991a6
Closes-Bug: the-one-with-config-in-place
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/745105
Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

commit_message:
Optimise config

This patch builds upon genconfig optimisation and it takes it
further by not having genconfig ever touch the handlers!
It also depends on the config checking fix.

I have noticed some handlers missing the necessary guard,
making genconfig actually able to restart some containers before.
This patches fixes that.

Oh, and this gets us closer to the single responsibility principle -
config only generates the config, container checks only validate
whether container restart is needed.

Future work:
- optimise config by doing local generation and mass rsync
- support for reloads
- unconditional restart/reload (separate action)
- make 'reconfigure' act like 'genconfig' + 'deploy-containers'
  - this would avoid calling bootstrapping each time but might
    be tricky as it would break current compatibility
  - could call this 'reconfigure-containers' and deprecate
    'reconfigure'

Change-Id: I0ce24043ae5486b2b55489ba40abe2b96b0991a6
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/773246

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix NFS extend attached volume feature

This fix is similar to the one for generic NFS driver [0].
If the NFS volume is attached, Nova libvirt driver will perform the
actual resize operation, so there's no need to do it from Cinder side.

Closes-Bug: #1878913
Related-Bug: #1870367

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/739079

Change-Id: I9d1d958acc85ee87a2ea0dae650ba4619482a688

commit_message:
Add support for ssl parameters of [keystone_auth]

This change adds support for [keystone_auth] parameters related to
SSL. The existing configuration logic in the authtoken class is
removed, to avoid conflicts. Even if these parameters are not set,
magnum is supposed to load the corresponding parameters in
the [keystone_authtoken] section.

Change-Id: I2dae947eb2d73d59d3364e19e0b96bc5a6c327cf

commit_message:
keystone_auth: Make the password parameter required

... because the [keystone_auth] password parmaeter is mandatory to let
Magnum authenticate with Keystone properly.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/823992

subject: Etcd: Update cluster membership when replacing a node
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-28 18:25:54.000000000', 'message': 'Etcd: Update cluster membership when replacing a node

Add the ability to replace an overcloud node that's running the etcd
service by updating the etcd cluster's membership to delete the old
node (the one being replaced) with the new replacement node.

etcd maintains its cluster membership using each node's name and it's
cluster peer address on the internal_api network. This data typically
changes when replacing an overcloud node. The cluster membership is
updated using a shell script that's triggered to run after etcd is
deployed on the new node.

A new EtcdInitialClusterState parameter is introduced. It defaults
to "new," and only needs to be set to "existing" when the cluster
membership changes.

NOTE(stable/victoria):
  The backport dealt with conflicts due to these changes that were
  introduced in wallaby:
  - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/771832
  - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/820111

Change-Id: I8daa5500e7ee722eef64808306dc2aa5ca027a15
(cherry picked from commit d3d20bb4423a66ff0e547b487041716f78ff83df)
(cherry picked from commit ba22896c62b8d90253ff839f62d69b2e18d86c3a)
(cherry picked from commit a9a4d54232c113c955b08209455a0f5fb796360b)
(cherry picked from commit 13015dba8139c943c034125587c2462a6933da09)
'}]
commit_message:
Etcd: Update cluster membership when replacing a node

Add the ability to replace an overcloud node that's running the etcd
service by updating the etcd cluster's membership to delete the old
node (the one being replaced) with the new replacement node.

etcd maintains its cluster membership using each node's name and it's
cluster peer address on the internal_api network. This data typically
changes when replacing an overcloud node. The cluster membership is
updated using a shell script that's triggered to run after etcd is
deployed on the new node.

A new EtcdInitialClusterState parameter is introduced. It defaults
to "new," and only needs to be set to "existing" when the cluster
membership changes.

NOTE(stable/victoria):
  The backport dealt with conflicts due to these changes that were
  introduced in wallaby:
  - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/771832
  - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/820111

Change-Id: I8daa5500e7ee722eef64808306dc2aa5ca027a15
(cherry picked from commit d3d20bb4423a66ff0e547b487041716f78ff83df)
(cherry picked from commit ba22896c62b8d90253ff839f62d69b2e18d86c3a)
(cherry picked from commit a9a4d54232c113c955b08209455a0f5fb796360b)
(cherry picked from commit 13015dba8139c943c034125587c2462a6933da09)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-02 16:06:48.000000000', 'message': "Implement the 'remove-disk' action

This new action allows users to either purge an OSD, or remove it,
opening up the possibility of recycling the previous OSD id. In
addition, this action will clean up any bcache devices that were
created in previous steps.

Change-Id: If3566031ba3f02dac0bc86938dcf9e85a66a66f0
Depends-On: Id5027f30d51c23d2be4c34f82867d65a50b35137

commit_message:
Implement the 'remove-disk' action

This new action allows users to either purge an OSD, or remove it,
opening up the possibility of recycling the previous OSD id. In
addition, this action will clean up any bcache devices that were
created in previous steps.

Change-Id: If3566031ba3f02dac0bc86938dcf9e85a66a66f0
Depends-On: Ib959e81833eb2094d02c7bdd507b1c8b7fbcd3db
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/683

commit_message:
Fix delete zone transfer request with scoped token

This patch fixes an issue were deleting a zone transfer request with a scoped
token may fail.

Change-Id: I4522796ac056630c63798830e8f8d92628f14a37

[{'created': '2022-04-02 00:18:37.000000000', 'message': 'Users can cheat --limit by setting -1

Users can cheat --limit by setting -1 in server list.   This should
disable that possibility and enforce api.max_limit.

Change-Id: Ic9a186de40ee97b00e867ab1fc1635d1c26269c9
'}]
commit_message:
Users can cheat --limit by setting -1

Users can cheat --limit by setting -1 in server list.   This should
disable that possibility and enforce api.max_limit.

Change-Id: Ic9a186de40ee97b00e867ab1fc1635d1c26269c9

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-23 13:51:23.000000000', 'message': 'Format [oslo_cache] memcache_server when IPv6 is used

When Memcached uses IPv6 network, python-memcached requires that each
server name is formatted as is described in the following example.
 inet6:[<host>]:<port>

This change ensures the format is properly applied according to
the IP protocol version and cache backend used.

Note that the parameter in keystone was not properly formatted even
when IPs are used to set the parameter. This change fixes that and
ensure the parameter is properly configured.

Also, this change fixes the timing to apply any2array. The function
should be applied before we check the first memcache server by [0],
otherwise the logic to detect IPv6 address does not work as intended.

Backport note to victoria:
Resolved conflict caused by [1]. Also the keystone manifest is modified
to make the implementation consistent with the other two manifests.

[1] 34d78c5827be5b2410003dd76e7273159024650e

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/heat.pp
	manifests/profile/base/nova.pp

Backport note to ussuri:
Resolved conflict caused by the keystone::cache class which was added
to puppet-keystone during Victoria cycle.

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/keystone.pp

Backport note to train:
Resolved conflict caused by the following two facters.
 - Usage of absolute class names which was required in stable/train
 - The keystone_resources_managed parameter which was removed during
   Ussuri cycle

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/heat.pp
	manifests/profile/base/keystone.pp
	manifests/profile/base/nova.pp

Closes-Bug: #1964824
Change-Id: I22f8fc7f59b4eeac10c3a274c36daeaa1861fd69
(cherry picked from commit c127941d8f5244847016f7dfc342c5e285f3901b)
(cherry picked from commit 31e47eb33fba59d81b8e1a5d635af106c0e324d7)
(cherry picked from commit 99b2ba02b1d8adf56e29eaaf7c35406f5a999a2e)
(cherry picked from commit b595d70b40d9a78358f22772de3652b2fb9b6cb8)

commit_message:
Format [oslo_cache] memcache_server when IPv6 is used

When Memcached uses IPv6 network, python-memcached requires that each
server name is formatted as is described in the following example.
 inet6:[<host>]:<port>

This change ensures the format is properly applied according to
the IP protocol version and cache backend used.

Note that the parameter in keystone was not properly formatted even
when IPs are used to set the parameter. This change fixes that and
ensure the parameter is properly configured.

Also, this change fixes the timing to apply any2array. The function
should be applied before we check the first memcache server by [0],
otherwise the logic to detect IPv6 address does not work as intended.

Backport note to victoria:
Resolved conflict caused by [1]. Also the keystone manifest is modified
to make the implementation consistent with the other two manifests.

[1] 34d78c5827be5b2410003dd76e7273159024650e

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/heat.pp
	manifests/profile/base/nova.pp

Backport note to ussuri:
Resolved conflict caused by the keystone::cache class which was added
to puppet-keystone during Victoria cycle.

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/keystone.pp

Backport note to train:
Resolved conflict caused by the following two facters.
 - Usage of absolute class names which was required in stable/train
 - The keystone_resources_managed parameter which was removed during
   Ussuri cycle

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/heat.pp
	manifests/profile/base/keystone.pp
	manifests/profile/base/nova.pp

Closes-Bug: #1964824

[{'created': '2022-03-23 13:46:50.000000000', 'message': 'Format [keystone_authtoken] memcache_servers when IPv6 is used

When Memcached uses IPv6 network, the memcache_servers parameter should
be formatted as is described in the following example.
 inet6:[<host>]:<port>

This change ensures the proper format is applied even when hostnames
are used to define servers.

Also, this change fixes the timing to apply any2array. The function
should be applied before we check the first memcache server by [0],
otherwise the logic to detect IPv6 address does not work as intended.

Backport note to wallaby:
This change covers novajoin which was already removed in master.

Backport note to victoria:
Resolved the conflicts caused by [1]. Also, Mistral and Zaqar are
additionally covered by this backport.

commit_message:
Format [keystone_authtoken] memcache_servers when IPv6 is used

When Memcached uses IPv6 network, the memcache_servers parameter should
be formatted as is described in the following example.
 inet6:[<host>]:<port>

This change ensures the proper format is applied even when hostnames
are used to define servers.

Also, this change fixes the timing to apply any2array. The function
should be applied before we check the first memcache server by [0],
otherwise the logic to detect IPv6 address does not work as intended.

Backport note to wallaby:
This change covers novajoin which was already removed in master.

Backport note to victoria:
 - Resolved the conflicts caused by [1]
 - Mistral and Zaqar are additionally covered by this backport
 - Fixed wrongly named spec file for zaqar::authtoken

[1] 34d78c5827be5b2410003dd76e7273159024650e

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-07 15:50:55.000000000', 'message': "Fix perfload jobs after consumer_types

Since consumer_types was added to the API in
I24c2315093e07dbf25c4fb53152e6a4de7477a51 the two perfload jobs are
getting errors from placement as they are using the latest microversion
but does not specify the consumer_type when creating allocations.

The server could not comply with the request since it is either malformed
or otherwise incorrect.\n\n JSON does not validate: 'consumer_type' is a
required property

This patch changes the allocation request to specify TEST as consumer
type.

Change-Id: I31500e3e6df5717d6bdb6ed7ed43325653d49be5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix perfload jobs after consumer_types

Since consumer_types was added to the API in
I24c2315093e07dbf25c4fb53152e6a4de7477a51 the two perfload jobs are
getting errors from placement as they are using the latest microversion
but does not specify the consumer_type when creating allocations.

The server could not comply with the request since it is either malformed
or otherwise incorrect.\n\n JSON does not validate: 'consumer_type' is a
required property

This patch changes the allocation request to specify TEST as consumer
type.

Change-Id: I31500e3e6df5717d6bdb6ed7ed43325653d49be5

[{'created': '2022-03-23 13:22:27.000000000', 'message': 'Format [oslo_cache] memcache_server when IPv6 is used

When Memcached uses IPv6 network, python-memcached requires that each
server name is formatted as is described in the following example.
 inet6:[<host>]:<port>

This change ensures the format is properly applied according to
the IP protocol version and cache backend used.

Note that the parameter in keystone was not properly formatted even
when IPs are used to set the parameter. This change fixes that and
ensure the parameter is properly configured.

Also, this change fixes the timing to apply any2array. The function
should be applied before we check the first memcache server by [0],
otherwise the logic to detect IPv6 address does not work as intended.

to make the implementation consistent with the other two manifests.

commit_message:
Format [oslo_cache] memcache_server when IPv6 is used

When Memcached uses IPv6 network, python-memcached requires that each
server name is formatted as is described in the following example.
 inet6:[<host>]:<port>

This change ensures the format is properly applied according to
the IP protocol version and cache backend used.

Note that the parameter in keystone was not properly formatted even
when IPs are used to set the parameter. This change fixes that and
ensure the parameter is properly configured.

Also, this change fixes the timing to apply any2array. The function
should be applied before we check the first memcache server by [0],
otherwise the logic to detect IPv6 address does not work as intended.

Backport note to victoria:
Resolved conflict caused by [1]. Also the keystone manifest is modified
to make the implementation consistent with the other two manifests.

[1] 34d78c5827be5b2410003dd76e7273159024650e
